oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Field testing of potential new compounds for apple scab control in organic apple production.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pedersen, Seniorscientist Hanne Lindhard
Paaske, Klaus
Bengtsson, Marianne
Hockenhull, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Abstract - Improved prevention and control of apple scab caused by Venturia inaequalis without the use of copper is the aim of this project. Twenty potential new compounds were tested in a field trial in a single season. One compound was found to reduce apple scab infections significantly. The research continues in 2006 and 2007.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Pedersen, Seniorscientist Hanne Lindhard; Paaske, Klaus; Bengtsson, Marianne and Hockenhull, John (2006) Field testing of potential new compounds for apple scab control in organic apple production. Poster at: Joint Organic Congress, Odense, Denmark, May 30-31, 2006.
